description: This Kotlin file defines the NoteEditorFragment class, which is a UI component for creating and editing notes within an Android application. It manages user input fields, interacts with a ViewModel to load and save note data, and handles user actions like saving, deleting, and navigation.

classes.name: NoteEditorFragment
classes.description: An Android Fragment class for editing or creating notes, managing UI interactions, and communicating with a ViewModel.

methods.name: onAttach
methods.description: Associates the fragment with its hosting context, setting up the host callback interface.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the fragment, sets options menu, and loads existing note if applicable.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Initializes UI components, sets up event listeners, and observes ViewModel data.

methods.name: saveAndClose
methods.description: Collects input data, saves the note via ViewModel, and triggers the editor to close.

methods.name: onOptionsItemSelected
methods.description: Handles menu item selections for saving and navigation.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.description: Creates a new instance of the fragment with an optional note ID argument.
